Posts.Title: WHOSE READY FOR A MEET UP??

Posts.Content: Hi   i have a faulty gene Brca 2. i has treatment for my breast cancer   single masectomy, chemo and radiotherapy  and then had to have counselling for them to agree to do the other breast. Very happy with my choice but it is good to have the counselling so you can be sure you understand the choices you are making
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy or propheitic double mastectomy

Posts.Content: i wonder if they would do your radiotherapy  and then give you longer to think about things .Are you planning immediate reconstruction?     For me   i knew i wanted rid of my breasts  once diagnosed , i knew it wouldnt remove all risks as it can come back in the small amount of tissue left  it lessens the chance and i've got a lot of life to be living   i haven't bothered with reconstruction and couldnt be happier   hated  the period of time when i was lopsided. remember although massive operation  they would not offer it you it  they thought too risky sorry i cant be of any real help in your decision making   i just wanted to say  having a double masectomy isnt the end of the world and it does give me as fellow faulty gene sufferer some sense of control over my body

Posts.Title: Eating during FEC first week

Posts.Content: I found the episode where she is speaking to the breast care  nurse a little unreal  i have  never met  with a bCN without my consultant present esp when newly diagnosed   also her husband and friends  seems amazing calm    mine was completely devasted and unable to function for many months  ,  feel it reinforces fluffy pink breast cancer  rather than the reality  but maybe thats helpful to some people   and if it is thats really good      think the portrayal of simeads cancer  on corrie  much more realistic  in terms of personnal interactions  betyween sinead and daniel     Agree the  laughing thing with anaesthetic  was weird  as was the ability of the family to come onto the ward     on the day of both my  ops     my family had to leave me at 7am   and i sat alone on a ward for  4 hours til i was took down to surgery

Posts.Title: Guys, in a bit of a panic regarding diet - of all things!!!

Posts.Content: Hi   i have been on tamoxifen  for a year and a half     At first i was having headaches and leg cramps   , the headaches went after a month  however   i do get cramps in my legs if i havent had enough fluid and they are really painful   i was worried  at first about clots as i know that is a side  effect but they do go off when i drink lots of water    agree with the other lovely  ladies who have replied   that its best to give your BCN a call   but wanted to share with you my experience
